metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6437 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The base64encode function in base64.c in libimobiledevice libplist 1.12 allows local users to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted plist file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libplist++3v5 - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
libplist-utils - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
libplist3 - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
python-plist - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ratliff> vanilla 1.12 does not suffer this issue, it was most likely introduced during the post-1.12 refactoring of parse_bin_node

criterions.comment: libplist package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3').
